definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: She rode up bold as you please, m'lord, demanding words with you.
sentences.chinese: 她膽大包天的徑直騎了過來，大人，要求和你說話。

sentences.english: IS THERE any limit to the audacity of Scandinavians?
sentences.chinese: 這些膽大包天的斯堪的納維亞人就不知道個“度”嗎？

sentences.english: Now that they were backed up, these fellows became audacious in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人撐腰，這幫傢伙就變得膽大包天。

sentences.english: The man must be as bold as brass to have stolen money at mid-day.
sentences.chinese: 這男子膽大包天，居然在中午光天化日下偷錢。

sentences.english: There never was a hero who did not have his bounds.
sentences.chinese: 從來就沒有膽大包天的英雄好漢。

sentences.english: The bandits pulled off a daring bank robbery.
sentences.chinese: 這夥強盜膽大包天，竟把銀行搶了。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
